chapter.title: Language Bindings
chapter.para: Although the MATE platform is written primarily in C, it is written intentionally to make it easy to bind to other programming languages. Using language bindings, you can develop with the MATE platform natively in your programming language of choice.
Language bindings exist for many programming languages, and the MATE platform officially supports bindings for C++, Java, Perl, and Python.

section.title: C++
section.para: The C++ bindings provide complete coverage of the MATE platform, including GTK+, Libglade, and MateConf. The C++ bindings wrap all objects with native C++ objects and allow programmers to provide custom widgets with normal C++ inheritence. They provide a fully native API, with type-safe signal handlers, full use of the standard C++ library, and complete C++ memory management.
For more information on the MATE C++ bindings, visit the gtkmm web site.

section.title: Java
section.para: The Java bindings provide complete coverage of the MATE platform, including GTK+, Cairo, and MateConf. The Java bindings wrap all objects with native Java objects and allow programmers to provide custom widgets with normal Java inheritence. They provide a fully native API, using Java's class libraries and interfaces wherever appropriate.
For more information on the MATE Java bindings, visit the Java-MATE web site.

section.title: Perl
section.para: The Perl bindings provide native Perl interfaces for the MATE platform, including GTK+, MateVFS, and MateConf. The Perl bindings wrap all objects with Perl objects and allow programmers to use standard Perl practices to manipulate them. They provide a fully native API, using Perl's native data types wherever appropriate.
For more information on the MATE Perl bindings, visit the gtk2-perl web site.

section.title: Python
section.para: The Python bindings provide native Python interfaces for the MATE platform, including GTK+, MateVFS, and MateConf. The Python bindings wrap all objects with native Python objects and allow programmers to provide custom widgets with normal Python inheritence. They provide a fully native Python API which automatically handles details like type casting and memory management.
For more information on the MATE Python bindings, visit the PyGTK web site.

section.title: Other Languages
section.para: Full or partial bindings exist for many other programming languages, such as C#, Eiffel, JavaScript, Ruby, and Scheme. Even though they may not currently be officially supported by MATE, many of these bindings are of the same high quality as the official MATE bindings, and some of them may be included as official MATE bindings in future releases.
For a list of language bindings, visit the GTK+ bindings page.
